subject: From the Desk Of: Dr. Olayem
body:
From the Desk Of: Dr. Olayemi Cardoso
The New Governor of the Central Bank of Nigeria (CBN)
Zaria Street, Off Samuel Akintola Street ,
Garki 11, Garki-Abuja.
Email: 
olayemi@finmail.com
Our Ref: FGN/CBN/NIG/09/2024.
Dear Sir,
With all pleasure I want to introduce my humble self. I am Dr. Olayemi
Cardoso, the New Governor of the Central Bank of Nigeria (CBN).
My appointment as the New Governor of the Central Bank of Nigeria (CBN)
comes after the suspension and arresting of my powerful
predecessor, Dr. Godwin Emefiele, on the June 16th 2023 by The Department
of State Services (DSS) Abuja, Nigeria.
The order of his suspension and arrest by The Department of State Services
(DSS) was given by the new Nigerian President, President Bola
Ahmed Tinubu.
I write to inform you that the strong man behind the non payment of your
contract/inherited funds since years ago in office has  finally been
removed. You can now therefore, rejoice because your payment has finally
been re-approved by the New President Bola Ahmed Tinubu.
All you have to do now to receive your contract payment is to provide me
with the following details to enable me know that am in communicate with the
real Beneficiary .
(1) Your full name,
    Address,
    Telephone,
    Occupation,
    ID
    Bank detail,
(2) Your Contract/Inheritance amount (very important)
Thanks for your understanding as I look forward to your urgent response
Very Truly Yours,
Dr. Olayemi Cardoso
The New Governor of the Central Bank of Nigeria (CBN).
Email: 
olayemi@finmail.com

subject: Re:   From the Desk Of: Dr. Olayem
body:
Hello Dr. Olayemi Cardoso,

It's a pleasure to receive your message. I must say, the news about the changes in the Central Bank of Nigeria and the new President Bola Ahmed Tinubu is quite surprising! I wasn't aware of these developments.

I'm curious, how did you come across my contact information? And could you please elaborate more on this contract payment you mentioned? It sounds intriguing but I don't recall being involved in any contracts.

Looking forward to hearing from you soon!

Best regards.

Best wishes,
Irene

subject: Re: From the Desk Of: Dr. Olayemi
body:
From the Desk Of: Dr. Olayemi Cardoso
The New Governor of the Central Bank of Nigeria (CBN)
Zaria Street, Off Samuel Akintola Street ,
Garki 11, Garki-Abuja.
Email: olayemi@finmail.com
Our Ref: FGN/CBN/NIG/09/2024.

Dear Irene

Sir, good morning with hope you are doing great today, Sir I have gone 
through your email and the contents are well noted, I was surprised when 
I read email where you said you are not aware that Nigeria has gotten a 
New President and CBN Governor, getting to a Year now. Sir about a year 
now we had a New President and since than many offices has changed.

Regarding how I came across your contact, Please you know am new in this 
office and am working base on the instruction and the files I saw here, 
I opened some files here and I saw your email and some other information 
stating that you suppose to receive your Inheritance or Contract sum of 
$10.5m which has been approved severally, but due some delay from 
Government this funds was not pay out to the Beneficiary reasons best 
known to the formal Governor.

So now that we have a Government and me been the New CBN Governor I 
decided to write some of those involved to present their details so that 
I will commence the immediate processing for the release of the funds 
either directly from here or through Government Oil Reserve Account with 
the American Bank, to make sure we meet up paying Beneficiaries before 
the end of this first quarter of the year 2024.

Therefore I will advice you go back to my first email to you and supply 
me all the details I required to commence the processing for the final 
transfer of this approved US$10,500,000.00 to your account within 72hrs.

I will be waiting to hear from you.

Thanks for your understanding as we look forward to your mail
Very Truly Yours,
Dr. Olayemi Cardoso
The New Governor of the Central Bank of Nigeria (CBN).
Email: olayemi@finmail.com

subject: Re: From the Desk Of: Dr. Olayemi
body:
Hello Dr. Olayemi Cardoso,

I hope this message finds you well. It's interesting to hear about the changes in Nigeria, I wasn't aware of them. I'm curious, how has the transition been for you as the new Governor of the Central Bank of Nigeria?

Regarding your email, it's quite surprising to learn that there are some funds associated with my name. Could you please provide more details about this? How did these funds come to be associated with me? 

Looking forward to hearing from you.

Best wishes,
Irene

subject: Re: From the Desk Of: Dr. Olayemi
body:
From the Desk Of: Dr. Olayemi Cardoso
The New Governor of the Central Bank of Nigeria (CBN)
Zaria Street, Off Samuel Akintola Street ,
Garki 11, Garki-Abuja.
Email: olayemi@finmail.com
Our Ref: FGN/CBN/NIG/09/2024.

Dear Irene

Sir, good morning with hope you are doing good this morning, I must say 
am very sorry for replying your email late, as a New person in the 
office I have a lot of job to do that is why I could not make it earlier 
writing to you.

Sir I think I have giving you a little explanation about this 
transaction, your relatives or Company that connect with someone close 
to you has either left this inheritance, but I cannot just know how I 
can explain this matter, but I saw your email in a file which stated 
that you have some funds to Claim understand Nigerian Government as an 
inheritance which worth $10,500,000.00 that is why I decided to contact 
you for further notice and to let us know how you want this money to be 
release to you.

But all I know is that this fund originated from this country from the 
Account Department of the Federal Ministry of Work and that is why the 
files are still open for claim.

I will be waiting to hear from you.

Thanks for your understanding as we look forward to your mail
Very Truly Yours,
Dr. Olayemi Cardoso
The New Governor of the Central Bank of Nigeria (CBN).
Email: olayemi@finmail.com

subject: Re: From the Desk Of: Dr. Olayemi
body:
Hello Dr. Olayemi Cardoso,

I hope this message finds you well. I must say, your email has certainly piqued my interest! It's not every day that one receives news of unclaimed funds.

Could you please provide me with more details about these funds? For instance, how did my name come up in connection with them? And what is the exact amount we're talking about here?

Also, could you explain a bit more about the process for claiming these funds? I'm not very familiar with financial matters, so any additional information would be greatly appreciated.

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best wishes,
Irene
